&ltARRAY>.CLEAR() Syntax &ltARRAY>.CLEAR( [ Start as N [, End as N ]] ) ArgumentDescription StartOptional. Default = 1. The number of the first element to clear. EndOptional. Default = Last element. The number of the last element to clear.
Description The &ltARRAY>.CLEAR() method clears the contents of a single dimensional array. The optional Start and End arguments restrict the portion of the array that is cleared out. Example Assume an array "A" contains the following elements: ElementValue A[1]Orange A[2]Banana A[3]Apple A[4]Pineapple A[5]Mango A[6] A[7] A[8]
After A.clear(3,4), the array will look like this: ElementValue A[1]Orange A[2]Banana A[3] A[4] A[5]Mango A[6] A[7] A[8]
To remove blank entries from an array, use the &ltARRAY>.DELETE() method and the &ltARRAY>.INITIALIZE() method. For example: Temp = A.DUMP() A.clear(1, A.SIZE()) A.INITIALIZE(Temp)
